defs: act of scenting with perfumes or odorous substances; consecration of idols of deities, invocations of their presiding gods, and their worship before commencement of a sacrifice.
invocation of deities in a newly sculptured idol, while installing them.
settled permanently at a place; domiciled.
consecrated; installed as per the rituals.
perfumed; scented.
to establish oneself in a house; to fix one's abode or residence in.
to show religious devotion or reverence for; to adore or venerate as a deity or a person; to worship.
to cause to smell sweet; to perfume; to treat with a perfumery.
a woman neglected or rejected by her husband and succeeded by a co-wife.
near or besides the kidneys.
of or from the adrenal glands; adrenal.

either of a pair of complex endocrine organs near the anterior medial border of the kidney consisting of a mesodermal cortex that produces glucocorticoid, mineralocorticoid, and androgenic hormones and an ectodermal medulla that produces epinephrine and norepinephrine; adrenal gland.
(Geom.) a circle which, by rolling around the interior or exterior of another circle, generates a hypocycloid or epicycloid respectively; epicycle.
(Geom.) the curve traced by a point on the circumference of a circle that rolls around the outside of a fixed circle; an epicycloid.
a man who has married a second wife, while the first one is alive or is not legally divorced.
the act of a man marrying a second wife while the first one is alive or is not legally divorced; bigamy.

a session, - a) the sitting together or meeting of a group; assembly, as of a court, legislature, council, etc.; b) a continuous, day-to-day series of such meetings; c) the term or period of such a meeting or meetings.
an overlapping; act of one lapping over the other and extend beyond a part of.

to reach from beyond across, the edge and partly rest on; to coincide in part with.

of or relating to the Self, and the Supreme; of the spirit or the soul as distinguished from the body or material matters, characterised by the ascendancy of the spirit; showing much refinement of thought and feeling; spiritual.
